titleStmt.title: Theodore M. Morgan to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7751

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Collection House of MORGAN, HANSON & CO.,
N. E. corner Dock and Walnut Streets, Philadelphia.
Notes and Drafts collected in all parts of North America through Banks and Bankers
Particular attention given to the Collection of past due claims through Attorneys.
Dishonored paper transferred to our Attorneys on day of dishonor when desired.
Philadelphia, Septem. 13 1862
The Secretary of the State of Kentucky
Dr. Sir:

I beg leave respectfully to inquire if there is a vacancy in this County in the appointments of Commissioner of Deeds for your State. In case there Should be, and you will do me the honour to advise me to that effect I shall proceed to make application for such position forwarding at the same time the proper references.
